intro: Argyrolobium fallax, commonly known as the silver globular pea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spherical, silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has a sprawling growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a notable species in its native environment.
